entries.title: Samsung confirms Galaxy S23 will launch right on time and teases new cameras
entries.description: Samsung will announce the Galaxy S23 on February 1, and reserve sales for the as-yet unnamed device have begun

entries.title: The best projectors of CES 2023
entries.description: CES is the top venue for new TV launches, but this year's show also featured an impressive number of projectors.

entries.title: Amazon will now let shoppers buy with Prime on third-party sites
entries.description: Use Amazon Prime to order from some of your favorite companies starting next month.

entries.title: Meta's new ad policy further protects teen privacy and tackles discrimination
entries.description: To help out, Meta adds new privacy controls and is implementing a new AI system to roll out ads fairly.

entries.title: PyPl has been found hosting AWS keys and malware once again
entries.description: PyPI packages found hosting sensitive data that could be used for a wide variety of criminal activity.

entries.title: JsonWebToken open source library has a significant security flaw
entries.description: Hackers could have used flaw to remotely execute malicious code on affected endpoints.

entries.title: Every AR, VR, MR, and XR headset we saw at CES 2023
entries.description: In all shapes and sizes, eyewear is getting a high tech makeover. Here's all the latest gear

entries.title: Malware campaign targets Kubernetes clusters
entries.description: The campaign seeks to install the Kinsing malware, which is later used to deploy cryptominers.

entries.title: TechRadar Pro, TWICE and Residential Systems announce Picks Awards winners for CES 2023
entries.description: See which companies took home this year's awards!

entries.title: The US government is building an AI sandbox to tackle cybercrime
entries.description: Joint project between Homeland Security and CISA will use AI in experiments to learn about real-world cyberthreats.

entries.title: 'Like something out of Spy Kids': Marvel fans can't get over MODOK's design in Ant-Man 3
entries.description: Marvel supervillain MODOK will make his MCU debut in Ant-Man 3 – but fans can't agree over his design.

entries.title: One of the best GPU utilities out there is under threat
entries.description: MSI Afterburner is a very popular tool for overclocking and more – but its developer recently said it’s ‘probably’ dead.

entries.title: Microsoft snaps up Fungible for Azure cloud and data center boost
entries.description: Microsoft confirms Fungible deal with hopes to bring its DPU tech to Azure.

entries.title: You can stream PS5 games to a Sony car but not a Sony TV
entries.description: Sony has unveiled its collaboration with Honda, which will allow you to stream and play PS5 games from your smart car.

entries.title: Google One hits a billion downloads
entries.description: The company's cloud expansion app offers useful features that explain its large uptake

entries.title: New GitHub code scanning tech should make it easier to spot security flaws
entries.description: GitHub is offering users a new way to enable code scanning and hopefully spot issues before they worsen.

entries.title: Victrola's cheaper Sonos turntable looks like a modern vinyl winner
entries.description: The Stream Onyx turntable boasts Sonos connectivity features for linking up to a multi-room system, for a lower price than the original Stream Carbon.

entries.title: How we test, review and rate on TechRadar Pro: professional and business monitors
entries.description: Independent, authoritative testing - guaranteed.

entries.title: How we test, review and rate on TechRadar Pro: standing desks
entries.description: Independent, authoritative testing - guaranteed.

entries.title: Can a new-look Windows 11 make more people love it?
entries.description: It seems we could get an all-new File Explorer this year, but will that be a good thing?

entries.title: Identity thieves crack major Experian security flaw, access customer credit reports
entries.description: Access to Experian reports hacked by tweaking the URL, but they were filled with inaccuracies.

entries.title: Google Docs update could make voice typing genuinely useful
entries.description: A Google Docs update is promising to bring a much-improved voice-typing feature – and it'll be available outside Chrome, too.

entries.title: iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Plus rumored to feature Apple's Dynamic Island
entries.description: New rumors suggest the iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Plus will feature Apple's Dynamic Island.

entries.title: DJI RS 3 Mini is the super-light gimbal YouTubers have been waiting for
entries.description: While it can't hold heavy camera setups, the DJI RS 3 Mini makes up for it when its portability and stability features.

entries.title: How Animal Well uses the PS5 hardware for its new beautiful Metroidvania world
entries.description: The upcoming Animal Well takes advantage of the PS5 console’s hardware in some unexpected ways for its art style.

entries.title: What does a wet and dry vacuum cleaner do?
entries.description: A wet and dry vacuum cleaner is a powerful and versatile appliance to have around the home.

entries.title: Instagram finally drops the shopping tab from its news feed to focus on content
entries.description: Instagram has announced that the 'new post' icon is back to where it should have stayed at all along.

entries.title: Meta is scaling back support for the Oculus Quest, but your Quest 2 is safe for now
entries.description: Meta is no longer offering full support for the Oculus Quest, with owners being told their gadget won't be getting new features.

entries.title: Micron's next high-powered SSD could fit in your laptop
entries.description: Micron unveils its next-generation NVMe SSD, with huge improvements and the environment in mind.

entries.title: Microsoft has a new text-to-speech AI tool to wow and annoy us
entries.description: New AI tool promises to mimic any voice from a 3-second clip, but experts warn of potential risks.

entries.title: Nvidia RTX 4090 laptop GPU price revealed – and it’s seriously expensive
entries.description: As pricey as the desktop version – but you’re not getting nearly the same level of performance.

entries.title: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania trailer breakdown: 6 things you may have missed
entries.description: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania's final trailer has arrived – here are six things you might have missed.

entries.title: The Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra could have more camera upgrades than expected
entries.description: A case leak suggests that the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra could have much bigger lenses than the S22 Ultra.

entries.title: It's official: Microsoft confirms the end of Windows 7 and 8
entries.description: Windows 7 and 8/8.1 will no longer get official Microsoft support, so it's time to upgrade.

entries.title: Why I'm still going to stand my PS5 vertically, despite the alleged risk
entries.description: Evidence that standing your PS5 up vertically remains extremely rare, making the claims difficult to verify.

entries.title: NordVPN passes third no-logs audit with flying colors
entries.description: NordVPN's latest audit showed the provider's continuous effort to retain users' trust to protect at best their privacy.

entries.title: Raspberry Pi’s new camera is the DIY project I've been looking for
entries.description: Raspberry Pi's new Camera Module 3 brings new treats like autofocus and HDR – and that could finally convince me to make a MarkCam.
